revised_title: Glycogen-Lactic Acid Breakdown in Muscle: Free Energy and Thermodynamics
tldr: This article investigates the free energy of glycogen-lactic acid breakdown in muscle. The authors discuss historical observations and thermodynamic data, concluding that the breakdown of glycogen to lactic acid in muscle can release more mechanical work than the total loss of energy, suggesting a possible difference in the specific heat of the two substances.
